title: Could low air quality pull down your house price?
text:
Air pollution accounts for 40,000 avoidable deaths a year in the UK. It causes heart attacks, strokes and, according to a new study, baldness.

An investigation into air quality in the capital by Imperial College London found that 24pc of play spaces and 27pc of public parks had nitrogen dioxide (N02) levels above the European threshold. So could it affect the price of your home?

Humphrey Milles, the founder of the Central Office of Public Interest (COPI), thinks so. He launched an air quality campaign, addresspollution.org, that lets anyone search a London postcode to see a neighbourhood’s air quality rating and helps them make calls to action of their MPs.

In an unusual reversal of fortunes,...
description: Air pollution accounts for 40,000 avoidable deaths a year in the UK.
